activity-description.narrative: El Proyecto apoya a las instituciones del estado, las cuales se centran en Asunción.

description.narrative: first-order administrative division

Level of agreement on sustainable production approaches including deforestation free supply chains international certification standards best practices for production and conservation land zoning criteria for corridors biosafety

comment.narrative: PY3 minimum environmental standards for soy and livestock production agreed by the multistakeholder platforms

During 2015 second quarter Project team and the Sustainable Finance Round Table made up of 7 banks prepared ToR for a costbenefit analysis on soybean certification squemes This work is expected to conclude in 2015 first quarter
This process will contribute to the establishment of minimum environmental standards for Soybean production that will be agreed upon in multisectoral platforms

description.narrative: Percentage of increase in the amount collected by SEAM for fines charged from infringement of forest and environmental regulations

comment.narrative: Average annual amount collected by SEAM is US270000

Decree N 2598 was enacted on November2014 to regulate article 5 of Law 5146 of Fees and Fines Project team worked with the SEAM on the ToR for the identification and implementation of technical legal and financial adjustments so as to strengthen the scheme of the administrative responsibility and to increase the amount collected by the SEAM from fines charged for the violation of forestry and environmental laws which will be reported in the next PIR period

Decree N 2598 was enacted on November2014 to regulate article 5 of Law 5146 of Fees and Fines Project team worked with the SEAM on the ToR for the identification and implementation of technical legal and financial adjustments so as to strengthen the scheme of the administrative responsibility and to increase the amount collected by the SEAM from fines charged for the violation of forestry and environmental laws which will be reported in the next PIR period

description.narrative: Improved institutional capacities to effectively plan implement monitor and mainstream biodiversity into production activities at landscape level as measured by a of increase in the Capacity Scorecard

comment.narrative: SEAM and INFONA average 46
At least 80 average

One of the key institutional capacities to be improved through project implementation is the review of the environmental legal framework that allows for the adequate fulfillment of the roles and responsabilities of the institutions involved The results provided by the revision of the main 8 laws of the environmental regulatory framework will be shown during the next PIR report period
At least 80 average

One of the key institutional capacities to be improved through project implementation is the review of the environmental legal framework that allows for the adequate fulfillment of the roles and responsabilities of the institutions involved The results provided by the revision of the main 8 laws of the environmental regulatory framework will be shown during the next PIR report period

description.narrative:
Surface area of soy in the 3 priority areas prepared for certification and certified under international certification schemes contributing to a deforestation free supply chain evidenced by
a Number of hectares applying minimum environmental standards in preparation for certification under international schemes
b Number of hectares certified

comment.narrative: 23000 ha of RTRS certified soy in the Department of San Pedro outside the UPAF 65000 ha under ISCC scheme by ADM

Based on the permanent construction of trust and credibility within the multisectorial dialogue process during 2015 second quarter 2 additional formal cofinancing agreements were reached with ADM and the Sustainable Finance Round Table for a total amount of US 1317276 and US 6507572 respectively
These agreements will lead to increasing the surface of certified hectares as well as the inclusion of environmental criteria into credits and the increase of financing for the implementation of best agricultural and livestock practices
Progress regarding these agreements will be reported in the next PIR report period

Based on the permanent construction of trust and credibility within the multisectorial dialogue process during 2015 second quarter 2 additional formal cofinancing agreements were reached with ADM and the Sustainable Finance Round Table for a total amount of US 1317276 and US 6507572 respectively
These agreements will lead to increasing the surface of certified hectares as well as the inclusion of environmental criteria into credits and the increase of financing for the implementation of best agricultural and livestock practices
Progress regarding these agreements will be reported in the next PIR report period

description.narrative: The biodiversity and ecosystem functions of the Atlantic Forest ecoregion is protected from existing and emerging threats from multisectoral production practices and is a model for replication across the countrys bioregions and biomes

Tons of avoided emissions of CO2eq attained through protection of forests in the REDD pilot project
a Direct lifetime 6000 ha
b Indirect lifetime 65000 ha

comment.narrative: Baseline map of carbon stocks for the UPAF estimates a minimum of 222 tCha and a maximum of 1898 tCha average of 64 tCha

a 1408128 tonCO2eq
b 15254720 tonCO2eq

The projects technical team contacted 2 universities Universidad Nacional del Este and Universidad Nacional de Asuncion to explore joint investigation fields in order to produce information on carbon stocks calculation in addition to that resulting from other projects implemented at national level ONUREDD and Climate Change
Pilot REDD projets were not carried out It is estimated that they will be iniated by the end of the year 2016

description.narrative:
Surface area in the MUL where sustainable production practices 1 or more have been adopted on the basis of the Best Practice Manuals and contribute to establish deforestation free supply chains
a Number of hectares achieved through direct project intervention in the 3 priority areas
b Number of hectares that can be potentially achieved through indirect effect of project intervention replication

comment.narrative: Practices focus on soil conservation and management medium and large producers Small farmers with degraded soils Intensive use of agrochemicals Lack of environmental criteria

a 500000 ha soy 60000 ha livestock
b 900000 ha soy 398000 ha livestock

Report on both indicator will be possible when the Best Practice Manual has been adopted and farmer training has successfully occurred expected by year 3
Best practice design process has started in june 2015 through working session with the two main agriculture and livestock production chambers UGP and ARPthe Paraguayan Chamber of Oil seeds and Cereals Processors and Exporters CAPPRO and 7 local banks members of the Sustainable Finance Round Table a work plan has been concluded which main purpose is to raise awareness on good agricultural and livestock practices

a 3000 ha to be adjusted when the Monitoring System is operational
b 6000 ha to be adjusted when the Monitoring System is operational
c 90000 ha of legal setasides 30000 ha of protective forests
to be adjusted when the Monitoring System is operational

Report on all 3 indicator will be possible once the legal framework adjust process has finished as a basis for the design and implementation of the monitoring system in pilot sites expected by year 3 Legal framework adjust process has started in February 2015 and it is expected to be completed by 2016 second quarter
To this date Terms of Reference have been agreed by the SEAM and the INFONA the governing institutions that regulate environmental and forestry respectively for the review gap analysis and modifications of the 8 main environment forestry existing laws and regulations to allow for the effective establishment of the law enforcement monitoring system and of the environmental services trading squemes
The results of this revision of the legal framework will be reported in the following PIR reporting period specifically including that of the Law of environmental services
An explicit update on the status of the others indicators will be posible by year 2017 when the related enabling activities has finished

a 3000 ha to be adjusted when the Monitoring System is operational
b 6000 ha to be adjusted when the Monitoring System is operational
c 90000 ha of legal setasides 30000 ha of protective forests
to be adjusted when the Monitoring System is operational

Report on all 3 indicator will be possible once the legal framework adjust process has finished as a basis for the design and implementation of the monitoring system in pilot sites expected by year 3 Legal framework adjust process has started in February 2015 and it is expected to be completed by 2016 second quarter
To this date Terms of Reference have been agreed by the SEAM and the INFONA the governing institutions that regulate environmental and forestry respectively for the review gap analysis and modifications of the 8 main environment forestry existing laws and regulations to allow for the effective establishment of the law enforcement monitoring system and of the environmental services trading squemes
The results of this revision of the legal framework will be reported in the following PIR reporting period specifically including that of the Law of environmental services
An explicit update on the status of the others indicators will be posible by year 2017 when the related enabling activities has finished

description.narrative:
Direct reduction of pressures in forest ecosystems from production sectors as evidenced by
a of reduction in the use of firewood from native forests by grain silos and dryers
b of reduction in sedimentation of surface water bodies

comment.narrative:
a Tons of native firewood used by silos to be defined in PY1 data base to be established in pilot Municipalities
b Sedimentation to be measured in pilot Municipalities in PY1

a 50
b 5

The Paraguayan Chamber of Oil seeds and Cereals Processors and Exporters CAPPRO and the INFONA agreed on Terms of Reference for the design of a native firewood substitution plan to be launched early september
This document will allow for the establishment of a traceability regime performing audits of the firewood used by companies whose energy matrices are based on the use of this product This document will be finished during the next reporting period

a 50
b 5

This document will allow for the establishment of a traceability regime performing audits of the firewood used by companies whose energy matrices are based on the use of this product This document will be finished during the next reporting period

description.narrative: 1 - Número de hectáreas de bosques certificados para servicios ambientales 2- Porcentaje de aumento en la suma recaudada por SEAM por las multas cobradas por violación de las leyes forestales y ambientales. 3- Número de hectáreas aplicando estándares ambientales mínimos en preparación para la certificación bajo esquemas internacionales 4- % de cumplimiento del pre-requisito de presentación de planes de manejo ambiental de acuerdo con las disposiciones de la ley EIA 5- Número de hectáreas de siembra directa siguiendo los Manuales de BP

comment.narrative: 1- Menos de 10 certificados han sido emitidos en todo el país 2- La suma anual promedio recaudada por SEAM es de US$270,000 3- 23,000 ha de soja certificada RTRS en el Departamento de San Pedro (fuera del BAAPA) – 65,000 ha bajo el esquema ISCC por ADM 4- a) 3 bancos (Continental, Regional y Bancoop) han comenzado a solicitar licencias ambientales a mediados de 2013 (dentro del sector público y privado de bancos, estos bancos cubren el 42% de cartera de la soja y 36% de la cartera de ganado) 5- Uso generalizado de siembra directa pero no necesariamente realizado siguiendo recomendaciones técnicas (manejo de s+- uelos y agroquímicos).
1 - 700 hectáreas 2- 10 % 3- 66.000 hectáreas 4- 100% 5- 200.000 hectáreas

1 - Se han certificado 14.835 ha en los 3 sitios piloto del proyecto. Adicionalmente y con apoyo del proyecto, se ha presentado ante el MADES las solicitudes para certificar 1.362,93 ha de bosques de 4 comunidades indígenas del departamento de Caazapá. 2- De 466.056US$ recaudado en el periodo anterior, se pasó a recaudar este periodo 513.858US$, es decir aumentó en 10,2%. Esta suma supera en 18% la meta final del proyecto. 3- Parcialmente logrado. 55.067 ha. 4- 14 de 17 bancos nacionales forman parte de la MFS y el 100% de ellos otorgan créditos cumpliendo con los lineamientos de sostenibilidad. 5- 594.000 hectáreas implementan siembra directa según manuales de buenas prácticas.

1-663 hectáreas, adicionales a las reportadas el año anterior, de bosque certificados para servicios ambientales en las áreas de intervención del proyecto. 2- En este periodo hubo un incremento del 10,3% en las recaudaciones en el MADES por multas cobradas. 3- 68.000 hectáreas producidas bajo los criterios del protocolo de producción de soja sostenible (nacional) y 20.000 hectáreas en proceso de certificación bajo los estándares de 2BSvs (internacional). 4- 100% de los créditos otorgados en 9 de los 14 bancos de la MFS cumplen con los lineamientos de sostenibilidad. 5- 594.000 hectáreas implementan siembra directa según manuales de buenas prácticas.
